title: Advanced Competitive Programming Concepts
description: A collection of advanced multiple-choice questions on data structures and algorithms for competitive programming in C++.

cards.question: Which algorithm efficiently determines strongly connected components in a directed graph?
Which algorithm is used to find articulation points or bridges in an undirected graph?
Which technique solves 2-satisfiability problems by constructing an implication graph?
Which algorithm finds the minimum cost to reach all nodes in a graph that also allows adding edges with costs?
Which decomposition method recursively splits a tree into smaller subproblems by removing a "center" node?
Which technique efficiently queries path information or updates subtrees on a large tree structure by decomposing it into heavy and light paths?
Which algorithm identifies an Eulerian path or circuit in a graph?
Which algorithm finds the maximum flow in a network with specific capacity constraints with high efficiency?
Which theorem determines the minimum cut separating a source from a sink in a flow network?
Which algorithm solves maximum bipartite matching problems efficiently?
Which algorithm is used to find all maximal cliques in a graph?
Which technique computes the lowest common ancestor for many pairs of nodes in a tree using precomputed jumps?
Which algorithm determines tree isomorphism?
Which data structure computes distances in a tree with dynamically changing edge weights or structure?
Which algorithm finds the k-th shortest path in a graph?
cards.correctAnswer: A* with Dijkstra on state graph

cards.question: Which algorithm determines if a graph is planar?
Which technique optimizes path queries on a tree by decomposing paths into a logarithmic number of segments?
Which technique solves problems on flow networks with lower bounds on edge flow?
Which technique finds the maximum weight closure of a directed graph?
Which data structure performs dynamic connectivity queries on a graph?
Which optimization technique speeds up DP recurrences where transitions involve slopes of lines?
Which DP technique solves problems involving subsets or bitmasks?
Which optimization technique solves problems by splitting the input into halves and combining results for DP?
incorrectAnswers: Divide and Conquer Optimization for DP

cards.question: Which technique speeds up DP transitions using a segment tree or similar structure?
Which DP technique is used on trees using re-rooting or specialized traversals?
Which DP technique solves problems by iterating through digits of a number?
Which optimization is applied to DP recurrences with a specific form allowing a divide and conquer strategy?
cards.correctAnswer: Divide and Conquer Optimization for DP

cards.question: Which DP technique computes states on profiles or broken profiles for grid-based problems?
Which DP technique solves problems involving expected values where states depend on probabilities?
Which technique speeds up DP recurrences that involve calculating power of a matrix?
Which DP optimization is applicable when the recurrence relation has a specific form exhibiting monotonicity?
Which data structure is used to optimize DP recurrences involving line insertion and query for minimum/maximum?
Which theorem is applied to solve game theory problems by computing Grundy numbers?
Which DP technique is used on DAGs for maximum/minimum path problems?
Which DP technique efficiently computes values for problems involving non-overlapping intervals?
Which optimization uses a bitset to speed up subset sum-like problems?
Which DP technique is used where the DP state represents a partition of a set?
Which optimization technique is used for range query based DP, often involving static or dynamic range queries?
Which DP approach solves problems where the state space is very large but the active states are few?
Which algorithm finds the longest increasing subsequence in O(N log N) time?

cards.question: Which data structure maintains dynamic connectivity information or path operations on a forest of trees?

cards.question: Which algorithm finds the centroid(s) of a tree?

cards.genre: Tree Algorithms (Decomposition & Advanced DS on Trees)
cards.question: Which technique is used to answer k-th ancestor queries in logarithmic time?

cards.genre: Tree Algorithms (Decomposition & Advanced DS on Trees)
cards.question: Which data structure is used to store and query paths in a tree using persistence?
cards.correctAnswer: Persistent Segment Tree on Euler Tour

cards.question: Which technique computes tree diameters or centers efficiently?

cards.question: Which data structure handles dynamic path aggregate queries (sum, min, max) on a tree?

cards.question: Which technique finds the k-th node on the path between two nodes?

cards.genre: Tree Algorithms (Decomposition & Advanced DS on Trees)
cards.question: Which technique optimizes queries on trees with square root decomposition?

cards.genre: Tree Algorithms (Decomposition & Advanced DS on Trees)
cards.question: Which data structure supports fast switching of parent-child relationships in a tree?

cards.genre: Tree Algorithms (Decomposition & Advanced DS on Trees)
cards.question: Which data structure can find the median of a path in a tree?
cards.correctAnswer: Persistent Segment Tree on LCA paths

cards.genre: Tree Algorithms (Decomposition & Advanced DS on Trees)
cards.question: Which technique answers queries about properties of paths crossing the centroid of a tree?

cards.question: Which data structure supports split and merge operations on trees?

cards.question: Which technique finds the "center" of a tree based on minimum maximum distance to any node?

cards.question: Which data structure is used for subtree queries or updates after flattening a tree?

cards.question: Which technique is used to compute subtree sums or values with modifications?
Which automaton efficiently finds all occurrences of multiple patterns in a text?
Which data structure represents all suffixes of a string and their properties, allowing efficient operations?
Which generalized structure finds the longest common substring of two or more strings?
Which data structure efficiently searches for patterns and their longest prefixes that match text suffixes?
Which data structure represents all distinct substrings of a string?
Which algorithm finds all maximal palindromic substrings in linear time?
Which algorithm performs fast string matching with a preprocessed pattern using a "failure function"?
Which data structure and its associated array are used to compute the LCP (Longest Common Prefix) for all pairs of suffixes?
Which algorithm is used to compute the period of a string or its subsegments?
Which technique efficiently compares cyclic shifts of a string?
Which algorithm finds the smallest lexicographical cyclic shift of a string?
Which data structure constructs a suffix structure to represent all suffixes of multiple strings?
Which automaton implements a fast text search algorithm by building a finite automaton from patterns?
Which technique finds the longest common prefix of two arbitrary substrings?
cards.correctAnswer: Suffix Array + RMQ on LCP array

cards.question: Which specialized tree is used to solve problems on palindromic properties of a string?
Which technique uses polynomial hashing for fast string comparisons and distinct substring counting?
Which algorithm finds all occurrences of a pattern that allows a fixed number of mismatches?
Which data structure constructs an automaton to represent all prefixes of a set of strings?
Which data structure or algorithm computes the Z-array for a string to find pattern occurrences?
Which data structure, often coupled with DFS, is used to efficiently find the k-th lexicographically smallest substring?
Which data structure supports range updates and range queries on an array efficiently?
Which data structure answers range queries for historical versions of an array?
Which data structure stores a collection of points and efficiently queries for points within a given rectangle?
Which data structure maintains a dynamic set of disjoint sets and performs union and find operations efficiently?
cards.correctAnswer: Disjoint Set Union with Path Compression and Union by Rank/Size

cards.question: Which optimization technique speeds up range queries on an array using square root decomposition?
Which data structure is used to query for the K-th smallest element in a range?
Which balanced binary search tree supports fast insertion, deletion, and search with randomized priorities?
Which data structure maintains a collection of lines and queries for minimum/maximum y-value at a given x?
Which data structure optimizes range queries involving range sums and updates on a 2D grid?
Which data structure supports range updates and range queries for minimum/maximum on a segment tree with custom operations like range assignments and minimum/maximum updates?
Which data structure handles queries on implicit intervals of a very large range?
Which data structure supports fast insertions and deletions at arbitrary positions in a sequence while maintaining balance?
Which balanced binary search tree self-adjusts based on access patterns, bringing frequently accessed nodes closer to the root?
Which data structure queries for order statistics (e.g., k-th element) in a dynamic set, often implemented with a policy-based data structure in GCC?
Which data structure stores and queries for specific bitwise XOR sums over a range?
Which data structure builds a structure to answer queries about the number of elements less than X in a range?
Which data structure manages sets of elements that support fast union, intersection, and difference operations?
Which data structure implements a segment tree that operates on ranges of lines, supporting insertion and query of minimum/maximum?
Which general technique creates a persistent version of a data structure to query any past state?
Which data structure constructs a sparse table for static range queries (e.g., RMQ, GCD) with O(1) query time?
Which algorithm computes modular inverse for non-prime moduli or large numbers?
Which theorem solves systems of linear congruences?
Which algorithm performs primality testing for very large numbers probabilistically?
Which algorithm factorizes very large numbers efficiently using a probabilistic approach?
Which theorem computes combinations (nCr) modulo a prime, especially for large n and small p?
Which technique solves linear recurrence relations using matrix operations?
Which algorithm computes polynomial multiplication quickly?
Which algorithm finds discrete logarithms modulo a prime?
Which principle is applied for complex counting problems involving overlapping sets?
Which theorem or technique optimizes counting problems using generating functions?
Which algorithm solves linear Diophantine equations for integer solutions?
Which theorem applies for counting distinct configurations under symmetry?
Which theorem determines optimal strategies for impartial games?
Which algorithm computes modular exponentiation for very large powers efficiently?
Which technique optimizes computations involving binomial coefficients modulo a prime power?
Which technique applies meet-in-the-middle for subset sum variants or similar combinatorial problems?
Which technique computes number-theoretic functions efficiently using sieves?
Which algorithm finds primitive roots modulo a prime?
Which technique computes values for problems involving expected counts/probabilities using combinatorics?
Which theorem is crucial for solving problems that involve converting a minimum vertex cover problem in a bipartite graph to a maximum matching problem?
Which algorithm computes the maximum flow in a general network with high efficiency?
Which algorithm finds the minimum cost to send a certain amount of flow through a network?
Which algorithm determines a maximum matching in a general (non-bipartite) graph?
Which algorithm solves problems that involve assigning tasks to workers with specific costs?
Which theorem models a problem as a minimum cut to find the optimal separation?
Which theorem finds the minimum number of vertex disjoint paths to cover all vertices in a DAG?
Which technique solves problems with lower bounds on flow through edges?
Which theorem determines the maximum number of edge-disjoint paths between two nodes?
Which algorithm solves problems involving bipartite graphs where a maximum matching is needed?
Which problem type, often solved by Min-Cost Max-Flow, models resource allocation problems?
Which technique solves problems like project selection with dependencies by reducing them to a graph problem?
Which theorem finds a minimum vertex cover in a bipartite graph by leveraging maximum matching?
Which technique determines if a set of demands can be satisfied by a supply network?
Which algorithm finds the maximum matching in a non-bipartite graph?
Which technique finds the minimum path cover in a directed acyclic graph?
Which technique solves image segmentation problems by reducing them to a graph problem?
Which technique determines the maximum weight closure in a directed graph?
Which optimization technique solves selection problems where choosing an item requires choosing its prerequisites?
Which theorem/algorithm is used to find the maximum number of vertex-disjoint paths in a general graph?
Which technique determines if a feasible circulation exists in a network with demands?
